edu.nyu.cs.omnidroid.ui.simple.model
Class Rule

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.omnidroid.ui.simple.model.Rule

public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object

A rule is a collection of RuleNode nodes. Each RuleNode instance has a single ModelItem and a list of zero or more child RuleNode items. This structure allows us to nest filters within other filters. The root node mNode is the root event. Action nodes are always appended to the end of the root node's child array. TODO: it may be convenient to move actions to their own separate array.

setRootEvent

public void setRootEvent(ModelEvent event)
Set the root event for the rule. This will clear all previous rule data since filters do not always make sense for all the rule types.

Parameters:
event - The root event to use.

public RuleNode getRootNode()

getHasAnyFilters

public boolean getHasAnyFilters()
Check if any filters have been added to the tree.

Returns:
True if one or more filters exist.

getFilterBranches

public java.util.ArrayList<RuleNode> getFilterBranches()
Builds a list of nodes which are top-level filter branches.

Returns:
An ArrayList of node branches containing filters.

getActions

public java.util.ArrayList<ModelRuleAction> getActions()
Extract all ModelRuleAction instances out of the tree and add them to the a list.

Returns:
All actions that are part of the rule.

getFirstActionPosition

public int getFirstActionPosition()
Find the first index of the root node that is an action.

Returns:
The first index of an action, or -1 if no actions present.

A natural language string of the entire rule.
